intro: Geraniospermum terebintaceum, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit and distinctive yellow flowers. The plant has thick, waxy leaves that help reduce water loss in dry environments. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Geraniospermum terebintaceum is adapted to survive in harsh, semi-desert conditions with minimal rainfall.
